bwwExcerpt: Director Bartlett Sher's usually strong hand seems to have focused largely on the staging, which is often quite effective. There is an especially nerve-wracking scene of close swordplay that is a visual highlight of the action. Ultimately, though, this Camelot revival falls on its own sword with its reworked book.
showScoreExcerpt:
“Problematic from the start and still problematic now in Aaron Sorkin's rewritten version, the revival opening tonight...continues to display the general mismatch between the enchanting score, beautifully performed here by both cast and orchestra, and its still-knotty book.”
